instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: VP0R error
threads.message:
3115 board <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>

pin1 - ground
pin2 - ground
pin3 - 3.3V
pin4 - 12.57V
pin5 - 12.57V
pin6 - 0.04V

I replaced <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> but still 0V at it.
Board power but will not load OS X and ASD tells there is ppbus error VP0R

pin6 - 0.04V is not ok, right? Not short to ground on this chip.

threads.title: VP0R error
threads.message:
VP0R is a voltage sensor, <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> is a current sensor..........

wich board is this???

threads.title: VP0R error
threads.message: It is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board.

threads.title: VP0R error
threads.message: ok, check <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>, corrosion is pretty common....

threads.title: VP0R error
threads.message: Will check tomorrow, but what about pin6 - 0.04V on <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>. Should be that 3V?? I have 0.04V

threads.title: VP0R error
threads.message: The question here is, are you getting VP0R error or a IO0R error???
